intro: Astragalus qohestanicus, commonly known as the Qohestan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its pods contain small, hard seeds that are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its survival in challenging habitats. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
